item.title: More about functions
item.description: Suppose you have many lines of code, and you would like to give this section of code a meaningful name. Functions are blocks of code that do just that. A function is a set of instructions that we give to the computer to store, and it can take in parameters (input data) and output data. A function in Python looks like this: Letâ€™s analyze this piece of code. The def tells the computer that you are writing a function.
